qas.question: What magazine awarded Southampton "fittest city in the UK" in 2006?
How many spots did Southampton lose in the "fittest city" rankings for 2007?
Who was the "fittest city in the UK" ahead of Southampton in 2007?
During the pre-war period, where was speedway racing held?
What year did Banister Court Stadium close its doors for good?

context: Southampton was named "fittest city in the UK" in 2006 by <a0_0>Men's Fitness<a0_0/> magazine. The results were based on the incidence of heart disease, the amount of junk food and alcohol consumed, and the level of gym membership. In 2007, it had slipped <a1_0>one<a1_0/> place behind <a2_0>London<a2_0/>, but was still ranked first when it came to the parks and green spaces available for exercise and the amount of television watched by Sotonians was the lowest in the country. Speedway racing took place at <a3_0>Banister Court Stadium<a3_0/> in the pre-war era. It returned in the 1940s after WW2 and the Saints operated until the stadium closed down at the end of <a4_0>1963<a4_0/>. A training track operated in the 1950s in the Hamble area.
